data: `minecraft:behavior.lay_egg` allows the mob to lay an egg block on certain types of blocks if the mob is pregnant.

data.Name: allow_laying_from_below
data.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Allows the mob to lay its eggs from below the target if it can't get there. This is useful if the target block is water with air above, since mobs may not be able to get to the air block above water.

data.Name: egg_type
data.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Block type for the egg to lay. If this is a turtle egg, the number of eggs in the block is randomly set.

data.Name: goal_radius
data.Description: Distance in blocks within the mob considers it has reached the goal. This is the "wiggle room" to stop the AI from bouncing back and forth trying to reach a specific spot

data.Name: lay_egg_sound
data.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Sound event name for laying egg. Defaulted to lay_egg which is used for Turtles.

data.Name: lay_seconds
data.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Duration of the laying egg process in seconds.

data.Name: on_lay
data.Description: Event to run when this mob lays the egg.

data.Name: search_height
data.Description: Height in blocks the mob will look for a target block to move towards

data.Name: search_range
data.Description: The distance in blocks it will look for a target block to move towards

data.Name: speed_multiplier
data.Description: Movement speed multiplier of the mob when using this AI Goal

data.Name: target_blocks
data.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Blocks that the mob can lay its eggs on top of.

data.Name: target_materials_above_block
data.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Types of materials that can exist above the target block. Valid types are Air, Water, and Lava.

data.Name: use_default_animation
data.Description: [EXPERIMENTAL] Specifies if the default lay-egg animation should be played when the egg is placed or not.
